business.headline: Wills aren't just for the old. Here's why you should have one tooFor most Indians, a will is something you think about when your hair turns grey, or you are on their deathbeds, but making a will early can be one of the most responsible things you do for your future.

Gold vs real estate: Where should you invest?Safe glitter or solid bricks? Investors have always loved gold and property, but choosing between the two can be tricky. With inflation, demand, and prices on the rise, it's time to ask—where you should put your money.

Adani Power bags Bhagalpur's 2,400 MW project tenderFour qualified bidders participated in the tender, with Adani Power quoting the lowest electricity tariff of Rs 6.075 per kWh (or per unit), sources with direct knowledge of the bidding process said.

Gold trades at around Rs 1.21 lakh per 10 grams: Should you buy or wait?Gold's shine shows no sign of fading as global uncertainty, a weak dollar, and festive demand keep prices high. But should investors buy now or wait for the next dip?
Sensex, Nifty end week in red amid weak global cues and FII sellingThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 94.73 points to end at 83,216.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 17.40 points to close at 25,492.30.

BSE share price jumps nearly 9% despite market slump. Here's what drove the rallyAt the end of the trading session on November 7, BSE shares closed 8.61% higher at Rs 2,666.90 apiece on the NSE, bucking the overall market trend.

Lenskart IPO listing next week: Will it deliver profits or disappoint?Lenskart IPO received a strong response from investors, and was subscribed 28.27 times overall, indicating robust demand across categories.

Not 1, 3, or Rs 5 crore. Here's how much Shiv Nadar donated per day last yearShiv Nadar and his family donated a total of Rs 2,708 crore in the last year, which comes to nearly Rs 7.4 crore per day. This is the fourth time in five years that Nadar has topped the list.

Why urban millennials are renting lifestyle products instead of buying themUrban millennials are rewriting the rules of ownership. Instead of buying lifestyle products, from furniture to gadgets, they're choosing to rent. The reason? Flexibility, affordability, and freedom from long-term commitments.

Planning voluntary retirement under UPS? All you need to knowThe guidelines aim to offer clarity and smoother planning for retirement decisions, ensuring eligible employees understand their rights, timelines, and benefits under UPS.

Groww IPO closes today. Here's what the latest GMP signalsWith the IPO closing today, attention now shifts to final subscription numbers and post-allotment reactions. Analysts expect a modestly positive debut given the strong retail response and steady grey market sentiment.

Financial watchdog to seek RBI's help in IndusInd Bank forex hedging probeAs of now, EOW officials have recorded statements of around 12 people from IndusInd Bank, which includes the former top management and other employees in connection with the ongoing investigations into the accounting lapse at the bank of Rs 2000 crore.

Why a magical 12% SIP may not give you solid returns? Expert breaks it downEither compare everything in nominal terms, without adjusting for inflation, or adjust every single figure — contributions, taxes, fees, and final value — for inflation, says expert.

Gold and silver are rising again. What's driving the fresh rally?On Friday morning, gold futures on the MCX were trading around Rs 1,21 lakh per 10 grams, while silver was trading over Rs 1,48 lakh per kg. Both metals have rebounded from their one-week lows, aided by a weaker US dollar and fresh geopolitical tensions.

Elon Musk's $1 trillion payday sounds huge. But can he actually earn it?To actually collect on this historic paycheque, Musk must achieve what Tesla's board calls "Mars-shot milestones", a suite of operational and financial targets.

Sensex tumbles 500 points: Why stock market is down todayThe broad-based weakness comes as investors continue to digest a mix of global uncertainties, ranging from geopolitical tensions to expectations of prolonged high interest rates in the US.

Lenskart IPO allotment out: Check latest GMP, listing date and moreLenskart's IPO allotment is done, but all eyes are now on its stock market debut. With strong demand and a steady GMP, will India's eyewear leader deliver clear gains?

Bharti Airtel shares tumble 4% in early trade. What's behind the fall?At 9:29 am, Bharti Airtel shares were down 3.66% at Rs 2,018 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with heavy volumes recorded in the opening minutes of trade. The decline came even as broader market sentiment remained weak.

Sensex falls 500 points, Nifty below 25,400; Airtel falls over 3%At 9:19 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 456.75 points at 82,854.26, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 129.40 points to 25,380.30. All major sectoral indices opened lower, led by losses in banking, IT and metal stocks.

Musk's $1 trillion payout approved: How it compares to Apple, Google, Meta CEOsThe pay approval, backed by over 75% of voting shareholders, grants Musk stock options that could fundamentally reshape how CEOs are paid in Silicon Valley and beyond.​

entertainment.headline: Gouri Kishan issues statement after body-shaming incident. Read it here Actor Gouri Kishan stood up against a journalist who made a comment about her weight during a press meet for her film 'Others'. After the video went viral, she shared a statement saying such questions are wrong and urged people to treat everyone with more respect and sensitivity.

Anushka Sharma's Chakda Xpress release in talks as makers appeal to Netflix: Report After years of delay, the makers of Anushka Sharma's 'Chakda Xpress' have urged Netflix to release the long-awaited Jhulan Goswami biopic, following the Indian women's cricket team's recent historic win. The film, completed in 2022, had reportedly been stuck due to creative disagreements and budget concerns.

Jeremy Renner accused of misconduct by filmmaker Yi Zhou: He threatened to call ICE Chinese filmmaker Yi Zhou has accused Hollywood star Jeremy Renner of sending her unsolicited explicit images and threatening to call US immigration authorities on her after she confronted him about his behaviour.

Baahubali series to Mirzapur movie: The great screen swap has arrived Indian entertainment is witnessing a dynamic shift as films turn into series and web shows make their way to the big screen. Audiences today crave stories that go beyond a single format, seeking deeper, more immersive experiences across every platform.

A decade later, Baahubali the Epic reveals its deepest truths As part of our Retro Review series, we revisit 'Baahubali', the grand spectacle that redefined Indian cinema, to uncover its buried moral questions and rediscover why its tragedy still resonates.

Jatadhara box office Day 1: Sonakshi Sinha, Sudheer Babu film opens with Rs 20 lakh Sonakshi Sinha and Sudheer Babu's supernatural thriller 'Jatadhara' opened to positive reviews but a weak box office start, earning around Rs 20 lakh on Day 1.

Haq box office Day 1: Yami Gautam-Emraan Hashmi's drama crosses Rs 2 crore mark Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi's courtroom drama 'Haq' opened to positive reviews and surpassed Rs 2 crore on day one. Inspired by Shah Bano Begum's landmark case, the film's powerful dialogues and performances are winning audience praise.

Frankenstein review: Guillermo del Toro breathes soul into the monster taleRelease Date:Fri Nov 07, 2025 Guillermo del Toro's 'Frankenstein' is a haunting reimagining of the classic, bringing science and sorrow together. Starring Oscar Isaac and Jacob Elordi, it trades horror for humanity, exploring love, loneliness, and the fragile heart that defines us all.

When Kajol was schooled by Farah Khan: Every woman is relevant even if not working Kajol's comment to Farah Khan about being "relevant" on her talk show 'Too Much' with Twinkle Khanna has sparked backlash online, with many praising Farah for her dignified response. The exchange reignited debates around respect and relevance that individuals deserve.

Rama Shama Bhama: Absolute laughter riot driven by Kamal Haasan, Ramesh Aravind 'Rama Shama Bhama' is a 2005 Kannada comedy-drama film which had acclaimed actor Ramesh Aravind debuting as a director. This classic featuring Ramesh Aravind, also featured Kamal Haasan, Urvashi and Daisy Bopanna among several other prominent actors.

Grammy 2026 nominations: Kendrick Lamar leads with nine, Lady Gaga scores seven Kendrick Lamar leads the 2026 Grammy nominations with nine nods, followed closely by Lady Gaga with seven, as the Recording Academy unveils this year's contenders ahead of the February 1 ceremony in Los Angeles.

Bigg Boss 19 Day 75: Pranit More's comeback leaves Farrhana, Tanya upset Pranit More made his way back into the 'Bigg Boss 19' house after recovering from health issues, but not everyone welcomed him warmly. Farrhana Bhatt and Tanya Mittal were noticeably unhappy with his return.

Shraddha Kapoor voices Judy Hopps in Hindi for Disney's Zootopia 2 Actor Shraddha Kapoor has joined Disney animated film 'Zootopia 2' as the Hindi voice of Judy Hopps. The film is set for a theatrical release on November 28.

Rajinikanth to be felicitated at IFFI closing ceremony for 50 years in cinema The 56th International Film Festival of India will pay tribute to the five-decade cinematic journey of Rajinikanth. The event will be held in Goa from November 20 to 28 and feature over 240 films.

Zayed Khan bids tearful farewell to his mother Zarine. Video The last rites of Zarine Khan were held with Hindu rituals in Mumbai on Friday. Videos from the ceremony show her son and actor Zayed Khan controlling his tears at the ceremony.

All Her Fault: Sarah Snook's thriller addresses every parent's worst nightmare Sarah Snook's mystery-thriller series 'All Her Fault' released on November 6, 2025. The show addresses every parent's concern about their child's safety.

Priyanka Chopra mourns Zarine Khan's death: I'll always remember you Priyanka Chopra has expressed her condolences on the passing of Zarine Khan, wife of Sanjay Khan and mother to Sussanne and Zayed Khan.  The actor's mother, Madhu, also condoled the death of Zarine on Instagram.

Is it official? Samantha's new cosy photo with Raj Nidimoru draws Insta curiosity Actor Samantha's latest post about courage and new beginnings has sparked buzz online, not just for her inspiring words, but for a photo with filmmaker Raj Nidimoru that's fuelling relationship rumours.

Mark teaser: Kichcha Sudeep packs a punch in deadly and fierce avatar Kannada actor Kichcha Sudeep reunites with 'Max' director Vijay Karthikeya for the second time in a mass action entertainer, and it looks raw, rugged and interesting.

general news.headline: Bihar needs startups, not 'hands up' gang: PM Modi's all-out attack on RJDPrime Minister Narendra Modi accused the RJD of trying to turn the state's youth into hooligans while asserting that the NDA is empowering them with education, technology, and opportunities.

Son didn't know it was government property: Ajit Pawar on Pune land deal rowAjit Pawar defended his son Parth amid allegations of irregularities in a Rs 300-crore Pune land deal, claiming the purchase was unknowingly made on government land, no money or possession had exchanged hands and the transaction has been cancelled.

Ahmedabad woman tries to rob jeweller with chilli powder, gets 17 slaps in 20 secondsThe woman sat in front of the shopkeeper with her face partially covered by a dupatta and pretended to be a customer. Then, she suddenly threw chilli powder at him in an apparent bid to rob the shop.

After India war lessons, Pak plans a unified command, more power for MunirMonths after its brief but bruising military confrontation with India, Pakistan is moving to constitutionally overhaul its military command structure. It is going to create a powerful new post for a unified command of its army, navy, and air force. The move will see army chief Asim Munir gain with the civilian government ceding power.

How Shah Rukh Khan saved Cheteshwar Pujara's career in 2009Book Excerpt: Cheteshwar Pujara's cricket career nearly ended due to a knee injury in 2009. Back then, Shah Rukh Khan personally played a pivotal role to provide complete support to the cricketer.

She was bullied, teacher ignored complaint: Parents of girl, 9, who jumped to deathThe parents of nine-year-old Amayra, who died after jumping from the fourth floor of her Jaipur school, have accused the teacher and school administration of ignoring her repeated bullying complaints and alleged a cover-up.

When Kajol was schooled by Farah Khan: Every woman is relevant even if not workingKajol's comment to Farah Khan about being "relevant" on her talk show 'Too Much' with Twinkle Khanna has sparked backlash online, with many praising Farah for her dignified response. The exchange reignited debates around respect and relevance that individuals deserve.

Vishwaguru will attend in person: Congress's swipe at PM after Trump boycotts G20US President Trump will skip the G20 Summit in South Africa, while PM Modi is set to attend in person, prompting Congress leader Jairam Ramesh to take a pointed dig at the Prime Minister.

Story of the birth of Vande Mataram, India's eternal soul cryOn November 7, 1875, Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay composed Vande Mataram, inspired by Bengal's spirit of Durga Puja. This six-stanza hymn fused Sanskrit grandeur with Bengali melody to become a spiritual and patriotic anthem that fueled India's freedom struggle, and also controversy.

Air India passengers stranded for 7 hours in Mumbai as snag delays UK flightMumbai airport: The Mumbai-London flight, originally scheduled to take off at 6.30 am from Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport, will now depart at 1 pm.

The New Luxury: How Republic of Nature Redefines Meaningful Living on ECRDiscover how Republic of Nature by GTB Developers is reshaping Chennai's East Coast Road with design-forward homes that blend luxury, nature, and mindfulness in one of India's most refined new communities.

IND vs AUS 5th T20I Preview: India hope to land knockout punch in 'Fortress Gabba'IND vs AUS 5th T20I: The Indian team have travelled to Brisbane to play their final T20I match of the series. Suryakumar Yadav's team will hope to land a knockout punch and wrap up the series.

Girl's first menstruation ceremony video is a celebration of womanhood, says InternetA Kerala woman shared a video of a girl's first menstruation ceremony that has delighted the internet, as viewers applauded the family's heartfelt celebration of womanhood.

5 Indians kidnapped in Mali as African nation faces al-Qaida, ISIS uprisingFive Indian nationals working on an electrification project were kidnapped near Kobri in western Mali, officials said, as the junta-led nation battles escalating jihadist violence and deepening instability.

IIM grad's Rs 3,000 offline AI tool to screen heart, lung disease wins Dyson AwardIIM-Kashipur innovator Tunir Sahoo has won the James Dyson Award India 2025 for JivaScope, a Rs 3,000 pocket-sized AI device that screens heart and lung issues without doctors, electricity, or internet. Built through 20+ iterations, it empowers ASHA workers with instant, clinical-grade reports, bringing diagnostics to rural India.

Wills aren't just for the old. Here's why you should have one tooFor most Indians, a will is something you think about when your hair turns grey, or you are on their deathbeds, but making a will early can be one of the most responsible things you do for your future.
Does a degree from a top college really matter in Indian arranged marriages?When it comes to choosing a life partner, would you value their education more or the bond and understanding you share?
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Hackers used WhatsApp images to target Samsung Galaxy phones for monthsA sophisticated spyware called Landfall exploited a Samsung image flaw to spy on users silently. The campaign targeted Galaxy phones in the Middle East and remained undetected for months, raising serious security concerns.

30 years of COP summits: Are we still where we started in 1995?For India and other climate-vulnerable nations, COP30 isn't just another climate summit but a test of whether 30 years of talk can finally turn into real, lasting action.

Baahubali series to Mirzapur movie: The great screen swap has arrivedIndian entertainment is witnessing a dynamic shift as films turn into series and web shows make their way to the big screen. Audiences today crave stories that go beyond a single format, seeking deeper, more immersive experiences across every platform.

Delhi airport resumes normal flight operations after hours-long tech glitchThe Indira Gandhi International Airport said the glitch-hit Air Traffic Control system has been resolved, and flight operations have resumed to normal after a day of widespread delays and cancellations.

PM Modi flags off four new Vande Bharat trains, calls it festival of developmentPrime Minister Narendra Modi has flagged off four new Vande Bharat Express trains in Varanasi. These trains will operate on the Varanasi–Khajuraho, Lucknow–Saharanpur, Firozpur–Delhi, and Ernakulam–Bengaluru routes.

Two terrorists killed as army foils infiltration attempt in Operation Pimple in J&KTwo terrorists have been killed by the Indian army as security forces foil an infiltration attempt in Operation Pimple in J&K's Kupwara.

Gouri Kishan issues statement after body-shaming incident. Read it hereActor Gouri Kishan stood up against a journalist who made a comment about her weight during a press meet for her film 'Others'. After the video went viral, she shared a statement saying such questions are wrong and urged people to treat everyone with more respect and sensitivity.

Jeremy Renner accused of misconduct by filmmaker Yi Zhou: He threatened to call ICEChinese filmmaker Yi Zhou has accused Hollywood star Jeremy Renner of sending her unsolicited explicit images and threatening to call US immigration authorities on her after she confronted him about his behaviour.

sports.headline: Rishabh Pant suffers injury scare in India A game, days before SA Tests Rishabh Pant suffered an injury during Day 3 of the 2nd unofficial Test against South Africa A at BCCI Centre of Excellence. He was struck twice in the morning session, first on his left arm, and later near the groin area before eventually leaving the field.

Manchester United's Ruben Amorim relaxed despite Benjamin Sesko's lack of form Ruben Amorim has admitted that Benjamin Sesko is finding it difficult to settle at Manchester United and urged the young striker to handle criticism as part of everyday life, "like a normal Monday."

Who are the overseas-born talents that Indian football team can call-up? With Ryan Williams becoming an Indian citizen and Abneet Bharti on trial, AIFF is looking to overseas talent to strengthen the national team. The OCI rule could bring in experience and skill from Indian-origin players abroad.

Josh Hazlewood confident in Australia's ageing bowling attack for Ashes Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood has dismissed concerns about the team's ageing bowling attack ahead of the Ashes, insisting he feels in peak condition and that the group's experience together remains one of its biggest strengths.

After beating Pakistan, India lose to Kuwait and UAE in Hong Kong Sixes India were beaten by Kuwait and UAE in the Hong Kong sixes. The back to back losses come right after their win against Pakistan.

BCCI raises Asia Cup trophy issue; ICC forms panel to resolve dispute: Sources The ICC has formed a committee to mediate the dispute between India and Pakistan over the Asia Cup 2025 trophy, following a formal complaint raised by the BCCI during its meeting in Dubai, sources told India Today on Friday.

Liverpool perfect opponents for 1,000th game as manager: Man City's Guardiola Pep Guardiola is set to oversee his 1,000th match in management when Manchester City face rivals Liverpool. The Spaniard reflected on his journey, his enduring rivalry with Liverpool, and the significance of reaching this milestone against such a familiar opponent.

How Shah Rukh Khan saved Cheteshwar Pujara's career in 2009 Book Excerpt: Cheteshwar Pujara's cricket career nearly ended due to a knee injury in 2009. Back then, Shah Rukh Khan personally played a pivotal role to provide complete support to the cricketer.

Cricket's return to the Olympics will strengthen the bond with India: IOC president IOC president Kirsty Coventry has welcomed the return of cricket to the Olympics, saying its inclusion at Los Angeles 2028 will strengthen the IOC's connection with Indian fans.

Michael Vaughan compares India vs Australia to Ashes, gets trolled on X Michael Vaughan compared the hype and quality of India and England's Test series against Australia. As expected, Vaughan claimed that the Ashes was the bigger contest. He was almost immediately trolled on X for trying to create what many fans called fake hype around the series.

I hated facing you: PV Sindhu's heartfelt tribute to retiring Tai Tzu Ying Two-time Olympic medalist PV Sindhu penned a heartfelt tribute to Tai Tzu-Ying, reflecting on the on-field rivalry they had built over the years, which eventually blossomed into "a quiet friendship."

Liverpool perfect opponents for 1,000th game as manager: Man City's Guardiola Pep Guardiola is set to oversee his 1,000th match in management when Manchester City face rivals Liverpool. The Spaniard reflected on his journey, his enduring rivalry with Liverpool, and the significance of reaching this milestone against such a familiar opponent.

As expected, Vaughan claimed that the Ashes was the bigger contest. He was almost immediately trolled on X for trying to create what many fans called fake hype around the series.

I hated facing you: PV Sindhu's heartfelt tribute to retiring Tai Tzu Ying Two-time Olympic medalist PV Sindhu penned a heartfelt tribute to Tai Tzu-Ying, reflecting on the on-field rivalry they had built over the years, which eventually blossomed into "a quiet friendship."

Has India learnt its lesson from Arshdeep experiment ahead of T20 World Cup?Arshdeep Singh proved his worth with crucial wickets in the Australia T20I series, reigniting debate over the team management's earlier decisions.

AUS vs IND, 5th T20I Weather forecast: Will rain threaten the Gabba finale?AUS vs IND: India and Australia clash in a winner-takes-all finale at the Gabba, with the series on the line. Clouds and rain could yet play spoilsport, but fans hope for a full-throttle contest.

Jannik Sinner beats Carlos Alcaraz again, gets big boost before ATP FinalsJannik Sinner defeated Carlos Alcaraz 6‑3 in a practice set ahead of the ATP Finals, despite Alcaraz leading their head-to-head 10‑5. The tournament, running from November 9–16, features Sinner in the Bjorn Borg Group and Alcaraz in the Jimmy Connors Group alongside Novak Djokovic and Taylor Fritz.

Did Sunil Chhetri hint at retiring from professional football after the 2025-26 season?Sunil Chhetri has called time on his international career and hinted at leaving club football if Bengaluru FC doesn't clinch the ISL. India now faces the challenge of finding a striker to replace the legend.

Novak Djokovic snaps semis losing streak, storms to Hellenic Championships finalNovak Djokovic ended a four-match semi-final losing streak by defeating Yannick Hanfmann 6‑3, 6‑4 to reach the Hellenic Championship final, chasing his 101st career tour-level title. He will face either Lorenzo Musetti or Sebastian Korda in the final.

After T20I retirement, Kane Williamson joins Durban's Super Giants for SA20 2025Kane Williamson has rejoined Durban's Super Giants for the SA20 2025–26 season, replacing Bangladesh spinner Taijul Islam. The New Zealand captain's return comes after his T20I retirement earlier this month.

ICC to expand Women's World Cup to 10 teams in 2029 after 2025 successThe ICC has announced a historic expansion of the Women's World Cup to 10 teams in 2029. Following India's maiden triumph in 2025, the move aims to boost competitiveness and give emerging nations a global stage.

AUS vs IND, 5th T20I Predicted XI: Will Nitish Kumar Reddy get a game?AUS vs IND: India head into the Gabba finale with a chance to seal the T20I series. The big question is whether the team will stick to a winning XI or hand Nitish Reddy his long-awaited return.

Novak Djokovic snaps semis losing streak, storms to Hellenic Championships finalNovak Djokovic ended a four-match semi-final losing streak by defeating Yannick Hanfmann 6‑3, 6‑4 to reach the Hellenic Championship final, chasing his 101st career tour-level title. He will face either Lorenzo Musetti or Sebastian Korda in the final.

After T20I retirement, Kane Williamson joins Durban's Super Giants for SA20 2025Kane Williamson has rejoined Durban's Super Giants for the SA20 2025–26 season, replacing Bangladesh spinner Taijul Islam. The New Zealand captain's return comes after his T20I retirement earlier this month.

ICC to expand Women's World Cup to 10 teams in 2029 after 2025 successThe ICC has announced a historic expansion of the Women's World Cup to 10 teams in 2029. Following India's maiden triumph in 2025, the move aims to boost competitiveness and give emerging nations a global stage.

AUS vs IND, 5th T20I Predicted XI: Will Nitish Kumar Reddy get a game?AUS vs IND: India head into the Gabba finale with a chance to seal the T20I series. The big question is whether the team will stick to a winning XI or hand Nitish Reddy his long-awaited return.

Meg Lanning predicts Alyssa Healy's successor as Australia captain after World Cup exitMeg Lanning has backed Phoebe Litchfield as the ideal successor to Alyssa Healy as Australia's next ODI captain. Litchfield was Australia's second-highest run-scorer in the Women's World Cup with a century against India in the semis.

AIFF in crisis as ISL draws zero bidders: What this means for Indian football's futureThe ISL tender closing without a single bid has pushed Indian football into deeper uncertainty. It raises serious questions about the league's financial future, the AIFF's credibility, and the stability of the sport's wider ecosystem.

Harmanpreet Kaur reveals special Sachin Tendulkar phonecall before finalSachin Tendulkar called Harmanpreet Kaur on the eve of the Women's World Cup final, advising her to stay calm. Inspired by his words, Harmanpreet led India with grit, guiding the team to their maiden ICC Women's World Cup title.

IND vs AUS 5th T20I Preview: India hope to land knockout punch in 'Fortress Gabba'IND vs AUS 5th T20I: The Indian team have travelled to Brisbane to play their final T20I match of the series. Suryakumar Yadav's team will hope to land a knockout punch and wrap up the series.

CSK confident MS Dhoni will be available for IPL 2026, says CEO Kasi ViswanathanIn an interview with India Today, Chennai Super Kings (CSK) CEO Kasi Viswanathan said the franchise is confident that MS Dhoni will play in the IPL 2026 season. Dhoni's return brings renewed hope for CSK after a disappointing IPL 2025 campaign, where they finished at the bottom of the table.

Sheetal Devi most inspiring human: Praises pour in for armless archer's giant featSheetal Devi became the first Indian para-athlete selected for the able-bodied junior archery team for the upcoming Asia Cup Stage 3 in Jeddah. She secured an impressive third-place finish after four days of intense competition at the national selection trials in Sonipat.

Jemimah reveals Annabel Sutherland's heartfelt text after Australia's World Cup exitJemimah Rodrigues revealed that Annabel Sutherland sent her a heartfelt message praising her composure after Australia's World Cup semi-final loss to India, leaving her speechless. Jemimah lauded Sutherland as one of the top all-rounders in women's cricket and expressed admiration for her sportsmanship and character.

Ellyse Perry era ends as Ash Gardner named Sydney Sixers captain for WBBL 2025Ellyse Perry's illustrious tenure as Sydney Sixers captain has ended, with Ashleigh Gardner taking over ahead of the WBBL 2025 season. Gardner, inspired by senior leaders like Perry and Alyssa Healy, aims to usher in a new era as the Sixers look to reclaim their form.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
